SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produção e Distribuição de Eletricidade, Gás e Água

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In Wind Electrical energy generating systems, due to fast voltage and current fluctuations, the power converter represents a source of electromagnetic disturbances. EMI problems of stand alone wind generators are here analysed in order to take into account many different power quality problems which result in voltage fluctuations and harmonics in the net. This paper, moreover, presents a Wind Turbine Experimental Simulator (WTES) that moves a Wind Electrical Energy Generating System (WEEGS) to carry out EMI measurements and the relative experimental results. The WEEGS here taken into account comprises a Wound Rotor Induction Generator (WRIG) in which the frequency transformation from the rotor to the stator windings generate interharmonics and the direct connection between stator and grid increase the sensitivity to voltage sag. These two aspects are here discussed and the existing solutions are pointed out.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In Wind Electrical energy generating systems, due to fast voltage and current fluctuations, the power converter represents a source of electromagnetic disturbances. The WEEGS here taken into account comprises a Wound Rotor Induction Generator (WRIG) in which the frequency transformation from the rotor to the stator windings generate interharmonics and the direct connection between stator and grid increase the sensitivity to voltage sag. These two aspects are here discussed and the existing solutions are pointed out.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: The Working Volume Position on a Non-Canonical Reverberation Chamber

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 6ème Conférence Européenne sur les méthodes numériques en Electromagnétisme

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a procedure for evaluating the performance of reverberation chambers by applying statistical and optimization techniques. The chambers configurations evaluation is based on the trends of geometrical and physical constraints, like the ones related to the E-field distribution recommended by standards. The importance of the present work is related to the analysis of a non-canonical reverberation chamber configuration, whose excitation is carried out by transmission lines, instead of antennas plus paddles and shows the advantages of using free-placed working volumes instead centre-fixed ones.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: Sistemas de Proteção contra Descargas Atmosféricas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The search for the Lightning Protection System (LPS) configuration that maximizes the regions inside the building, in which specified threshold levels are satisfied, is a very important topic of the LPS design. In this paper, an evaluation of the grounding system influence on a LPS Optimization Process is presented. The Constrained Decision Planning Method is applied. The resulting electromagnetic environment regarding a building directly struck by lightning is evaluated by time-domain simulations, and the ?safe area? and ?connectivity index" are used as figures of merit in this procedure.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents a theoretical evaluation of the phase-shifting excitation and load effects in a Transmission Line Excitation Chamber. It is suggested as an alternative for immunity tests because of the restrictions related to canonical chambers. Here, two methods are used to calculate the E-field: a semi-analytic approach and a numerical one. The semi-analytic method is based on the well-known modal expansion while commercial software is used for numerical simulations. The results regarding the field profile and the related statistical indexes of merit are presented and used to evaluate the chamber performance.

PB7 (Poster Session): EMC - Electromagnetic Compatibility

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents a multi-objective optimization approach based on numerical, statistical and fitness evaluation concerning the conductor positions in a Transmission Line Excitation Chamber (TLEC). The field profile and the related indexes of merit, like the statistical ones, regarding the working volumes are used to evaluate the chamber configuration performance. The compromise between working volume and E-field standard deviation are show through the Pareto?s Front.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A non-invasive methodology to evaluate and classify the electrical system failures is presented in this work. It is based on the electrical system magnetic signature recognition using the wavelet signal decomposition and the resulting variance spectrum evaluation, respectively. The validation of the proposed methodology is carried out by comparison between theoretical and experimental results. The Finite Element Method is used in the numerical simulations of the magnetic flux density, and a post-processing approach is adopted in the signal decomposition and analyses. An experimental setup was built to obtain the magnetic signature regarding some pre-selected faults configurations.

OC2 (Oral Session): Devices and Applications and Electromagnetic Compatibility
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
SAR validation measurements are already an industry standard, necessary to enable the distribution of commercial mobile phones. Here it is discussed the full wave simulation of a SAR measurement system, used to certify mobile phones in the international market. The electric field measured in a phantom by a mechanical system is modeled and compared with simulations, so that a validation is achieved and further sensitivity analyses can be carried out.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Sistema transcutâneo de transmissão de energia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work reports the development of the first Brazilian implantable VAD (Ventricular Assist Device) of centrifugal pump type. The development is being conduct by the Dante Pazzanese Institute of Cardiology and the São Paulo University. Some already achieved advancement are described: the geometry of the new VAD; the sliding bearing system using ceramic material, that supports the VAD rotor; the magnetic bearing system, that is an alternative way for supporting the VAD rotor and; the brushless motor, that will drive the DAV rotor.

EHE'09 Plenary Session IS-03 (Thursday Nov. 19th, 2009)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents experimental and numerical results concerning Transmission Line Excited Chamber (TLEC). This chamber is an alternative for electromagnetic compatibility tests, notably radiated immunity. The E-field profile, frequency response, SWR, and S parameters are addressed and compared. Besides application regarding performance assessment of electromedical equipment, this chamber could also be applied as a way to reload intra-body devices or to get biotelemetry information.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents experimental and numerical results concerning Transmission Line Excited Chamber (TLEC). This chamber is an alternative for electromagnetic compatibility tests, notably radiated immunity. The E-field profile, frequency response, SWR, and S parameters are addressed and compared. Besides application regarding performance assessment of electromedical equipment, this chamber could also be applied as a way to reload intra-body devices or to get biotelemetry information.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: Modelos Equivalentes de Fontes de Radiação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: EMC filters are increasingly integrated into power applications. To improve the filter performance it is important to model the electromagnetic interference between components to ptimize their positions. In this paper, a method is proposed to construct the equivalent model of the filter components. The proposed method is based on the multipolar expansion by representing the radiation emission of generic structures in a spherical reference (r, θ, φ). These models of the sources will be used to compute the mutual inductance between the components according to their geometric placement.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Serviços de arquitetura e engenharia; testes e análises técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electromagnetic interference between the electronic systems or their components influence the performance of the systems. For that reason, it is important to model these interferences in order to optimize the position of the systems or their components. In this paper, a method is proposed to construct the equivalent model of systems. The proposed method is based on the multipolar expansion by representing the radiated emission of generic structures in a spherical reference. Some results are presented illustrating our method.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The electromagnetic interference between the electronic systems or their components influence the performance of the systems. For that reason, it is important to model these interferences in order to optimize the position of the systems or their components. In this paper, a method is proposed to construct the equivalent model of systems. The proposed method is based on the multipolar expansion by representing the radiated emission of generic structures in a spherical reference. Some results are presented illustrating our method.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A hybrid approach concerning the calibration and evaluation of a loop antenna suitable for dipole and quadrupole identification is presented. The main aspects concerning the mutual influence of the loops are considered and emphasized, in particular, when the complete
measurement setup is utilized. Analytical and numerical methods are applied. The methods were validated by the available experimental and theoretical results, at the 60 kHz-180 kHz frequency range.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a case study related to the electric and magnetic fields generated by an upgraded high voltage overhead transmission line in an urban environment. Consideration of risk perception recommends a previous analysis of electric and magnetic fields. A computational model based on charge simulation method to calculate electric field and Biot-Savart law to calculate magnetic field is outlined. Model validation is done by simulation and measuring of electric and magnetic fields on neighborhood of the existing transmission line prior upgrade. Results of simulation of electric and magnetic fields with the new transmission line configuration were assessed to verify compliance with exposure limits recommended by World Health Organization. Magnetic and electric fields were measured considering the new configuration of transmission line.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a case study related to the electric and magnetic fields generated by an upgraded high voltage overhead transmission line in an urban environment. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The magnetic stimulation devices development, used as helping for fractures treatments, has been broadly investigated. The magnetic stimulation device here presented was designed for long bones application; with stimulation wave type selection, which change among sine, square and triangular wave. For each wave type, the frequency and magnetic field variations are evaluated in order to apply and establish physiologic comparisons in an experimental design (not presented in this paper). The prototype is limited to work in low frequency (10 - 100 Hz) for magnetic field levels reported as successful treatments in the long term in clinical literature (up to 2 mT). The device has a coil failure and overcurrent protection system. The applied stimulation technique is non-invasive through an elliptic Helmholtz coil, which generates a perpendicular magnetic field to the bone axis. Finally, the magnetic stimulation device was simulated in Flux 3D, and its performance were evaluated based on the available technical test characteristics.

Finally, the magnetic stimulation device was simulated in Flux 3D, and its performance were evaluated based on the available technical test characteristics.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Topologies of motor drive systems are studied, aiming the reduction of common-mode (CM) currents. Initially, the aspects concerning the CM currents circulation are analysed.
The reason of common-mode voltages generation, the circulating paths for the resulting CM currents and their effects are discussed. Then, a non-conventional drive system configuration is proposed in order to reduce the CM currents and their effects. This configuration comprehends a non-conventional inverter module wired to a motor with an unusual connection. The cables arrangement differs from the standard solution, too. The proposed topology is compared with other ones, like the active circuit for common-mode voltages compensation. The contribution of the configuration to the reduction of CM voltages and currents and their related interferences are evaluated, based on numerical simulations. Some results are presented and discussed regarding the suitability of the proposed configuration as a potential solution to reduce the CM currents effects, when the state of art and implementation cost of drives are taken into
account.

RE&PQJ-11 ISSN 2172-038X

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Large Loop Antennas (LLAs) are widely used for measurement of magnetic fields generated by electrical devices, as a requirement of international EMC standards. More recently, the use of LLAs for evaluation of equivalent radiation sources has been investigated and explored. Equivalent radiation sources have several applications to analytical and numerical EMC analyses, such as electromagnetic environment evaluation and failure detection. In this paper, a comparative study between two commonly used LLAs, namely the Kanda and the van Veen and Bergervoet antenna, regarding their use for determination of equivalent radiation sources, is carried out. The methodology employed in this study is shown, and analytical and numerical results on the antennas? responses and sensitivities to their construction parameters, such as load impedance, loop radius, and loop wire radius, are presented and analyzed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Large Loop Antennas (LLAs) are widely used for measurement of magnetic fields generated by electrical devices, as a requirement of international EMC standards. The methodology employed in this study is shown, and analytical and numerical results on the antennas? responses and sensitivities to their construction parameters, such as load impedance, loop radius, and loop wire radius, are presented and analyzed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: For EMC behavior of power electronic converters, it is important to predict near-field coupling between the complex components (e.g. in EMC filters). By using the components of near-field multipolar expansion of electromagnetic sources, the close magnetic coupling between two sources is determined from their equivalent models. It is shown that the complete identification of all components of multipolar expansion provides a more precise representation of the near-field around sources and thus a more accurate near-field coupling prediction. Theoretical and experimental developments are also presented.

It is shown that the complete identification of all components of multipolar expansion provides a more precise representation of the near-field around sources and thus a more accurate near-field coupling prediction. Theoretical and experimental developments are also presented.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper proposes a method for identifying and classifying electric and electronic equipment defects by using a large loop antenna. The method is based on the radiated magnetic field assessment, using Wavelet decomposition. As an application a set of four three-phase power transformers was tested for common defects and misconfigurations such as phase inversion phase disconnection and short circuits. For each type of defect, the signature or energy was characterized and classified. Some numerical simulations were carried out in order to compare with the experimental data.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper proposes a method for identifying and classifying electric and electronic equipment defects by using a large loop antenna. The method is based on the radiated magnetic field assessment, using Wavelet decomposition. As an application a set of four three-phase power transformers was tested for common defects and misconfigurations such as phase inversion phase disconnection and short circuits. For each type of defect, the signature or energy was characterized and classified. Some numerical simulations were carried out in order to compare with the experimental data.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: MOMAG 2014: 16º SBMO - Simpósio Brasileiro de Micro-ondas e Optoeletrônica e 11º CBMag - Congresso Brasileiro de Eletromagnetismo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Over recent years, the interest in using inductive wireless power transmission for many applications has grown. One of the major limitations of this technology is the limited operating distance. Some recent works have suggested using synthesized materials known as metamaterials to improve the power transfer efficiency over distance. Due to their unique electromagnetic properties such as negative permeability, metamaterials can be used to enhance the evanescent waves of the near-field. In the present work, the usage of a magnetic 
metamaterial to increase the inductive coupling by means of enhanced evanescent waves is studied. Analytical calculations and numerical simulations of the proposed metamaterial and its impact on power transfer efficiency are presented and supported by experimental measurements.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

Due to their unique electromagnetic properties such as negative permeability, metamaterials can be used to enhance the evanescent waves of the near-field. In the present work, the usage of a magnetic 
metamaterial to increase the inductive coupling by means of enhanced evanescent waves is studied. Analytical calculations and numerical simulations of the proposed metamaterial and its impact on power transfer efficiency are presented and supported by experimental measurements.

Best Symposium Paper Award (BPA) Finalists (Paper n. 1570058909)
http://www.apemc2015.org/BPA.asp

In EMC behavior of power electronic converters, it is important to predict near-field coupling between the complex components (e.g. in EMC filter). By using the components of near-field multipolar expansion of electromagnetic sources, the close magnetic coupling between two sources is determined from their equivalent model. It is shown that the complete identification of all components of multipolar expansion provides a more precise representation of the near-field around sources and thus a better accuracy of the near-field coupling prediction. Also theoretical and experimental developments are presented.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: FDCT - Fundação para o Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Our aim is to evaluate the feasibility of fault location in transmission lines by analyzing the magnetic signatures resulting from non-invasive measurements. Besides traditional monitoring methods, which use sensors physically connected to the electric power system, a non-invasive method seems an interesting way to satisfy the increasingly demanding economic and technical requirements. This paper investigates a fault location methodology based on an autoregressive modeling of the magnetic signature measured around the transmission line. The efficiency of the method is analyzed based on a simulation example which takes into account 8000 different fault scenarios.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Our aim is to evaluate the feasibility of fault location in transmission lines by analyzing the magnetic signatures resulting from non-invasive measurements. Besides traditional monitoring methods, which use sensors physically connected to the electric power system, a non-invasive method seems an interesting way to satisfy the increasingly demanding economic and technical requirements. This paper investigates a fault location methodology based on an autoregressive modeling of the magnetic signature measured around the transmission line. The efficiency of the method is analyzed based on a simulation example which takes into account 8000 different fault scenarios.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de máquinas, aparelhos e materiais elétricos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The importance of the radiated equivalent sources characterization and Electromagnetic Compatibility studies has been emphasized in the present literature. It mentions the methodology based on the multipolar expansion in spherical harmonics of the near-field sources. Details of this methodology and of the prototypes suitable for determining components of the multipolar expansion are shown, for instance, in (Vincent, Benjamin, et al. "Loop antennas for near-field multipolar-expansion identification: first experimental validations." Instrumentation and Measurement, IEEE Transactions on 59.12 (2010): 3086-3092.), and T. Q. V. Hoang, A. Bréard, and C. Vollaire, ?Near Magnetic Field Coupling Prediction Using Equivalent Spherical Harmonic Sources,? IEEE Trans. on EMC, Vol. 56, n°6, pp. 1457-1465, 2014.). Nevertheless, these prototypes requires that either the device under test or the loop sensors be constantly positioned between all the measurements, to get the proper components necessary to represent accurately complex radiated sources, thus resulting in a time-demanding approach.

In order to minimize the aforementioned constraints, an automatic system is proposed, in which the positioning feedback is done by computer vision and the movement is provided by stepper motors, and nonmagnetic pulleys, carefully located and operated in order to not interfere in the field measurements. To improve the mechanical precision, the main mechanical components or parts of this system were carried out using CNC equipment. The validation was based in previous results obtained by the authors. 

Although, the spherical harmonics are used so far, the proposed system also allows implementing the equivalent cylindrical ones, being considered as part of future work. Thus, higher degrees of precision will be allowed, since higher order and degrees of the desired component of the multipolar expansion can be obtained by this system.

Although, the spherical harmonics are used so far, the proposed system also allows implementing the equivalent cylindrical ones, being considered as part of future work. Thus, higher degrees of precision will be allowed, since higher order and degrees of the desired component of the multipolar expansion can be obtained by this system.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Electrically small antennas (ESA) are characterized by high-Q impedances presenting high reactance and low radiation resistance. Since in most wireless power transmission (WPT) applications, such as inductive power transmission (IPT), to use a full-size antenna is neither practical or desired, the system overall efficiency is usually very poor due to the drivers large reactance. In the last decade, various works have demonstrated that a class of artificial material called metamaterials (MTMs) can synthesize mu-negative (MNG) media capable of evanescent-wave focusing which largely enhances the coupling between ESA. In the present work, MTM-enhanced coupling in IPT systems is examined. Adopting a lumped element approach to describe the general MTM-enhanced IPT system, it is evidenced that MNG media can be interpreted as a negative inductance (a non-Foster reactance) from a circuital point of view. This paper also presents an approach based on energy density to calculate the module of the MNG slab equivalent inductor.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Electrically small antennas (ESA) are characterized by high-Q impedances presenting high reactance and low radiation resistance. Since in most wireless power transmission (WPT) applications, such as inductive power transmission (IPT), to use a full-size antenna is neither practical or desired, the system overall efficiency is usually very poor due to the drivers large reactance. In the last decade, various works have demonstrated that a class of artificial material called metamaterials (MTMs) can synthesize mu-negative (MNG) media capable of evanescent-wave focusing which largely enhances the coupling between ESA. In the present work, MTM-enhanced coupling in IPT systems is examined. Adopting a lumped element approach to describe the general MTM-enhanced IPT system, it is evidenced that MNG media can be interpreted as a negative inductance (a non-Foster reactance) from a circuital point of view. This paper also presents an approach based on energy density to calculate the module of the MNG slab equivalent inductor.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An important way to decrease the EMC issue is to predict near-field coupling between components. The use of the electromagnetic equivalent model in spherical multipolar expansion allows us to compute the near-field magnetic coupling. The method cannot be properly applied when the sources are too close. In this paper we use an ellipsoidal expansion system,and we propose a solution to to extend the efficiency of the method when the sources are close.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: An important way to decrease the EMC issue is to predict near-field coupling between components. The use of the electromagnetic equivalent model in spherical multipolar expansion allows us to compute the near-field magnetic coupling. The method cannot be properly applied when the sources are too close. In this paper we use an ellipsoidal expansion system,and we propose a solution to to extend the efficiency of the method when the sources are close.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Sistema transcutâneo de transmissão de energia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Com base nas referências normativas atuais é proposta uma metodologia de teste de
compatibilidade eletromagnética (CEM) focada na emissão conduzida para sistema de transmissão de energia
transcutânea (TET). Inicialmente é realizado o estudo de dispositivos médicos implantáveis ativos (AIMDs) que
atualmente utilizam a tecnologia TET com menor potência e escala. Posteriormente o sistema é dividido em
blocos e então analisado pormenorizadamente a contribuição de cada subsistema. Por fim é proposta uma
arquitetura de teste para que seja analisado a interferência (IEM) gerada no sistema como um todo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Based on the current normative references, an electromagnetic compatibility
(EMC) test methodology is proposed focused on the emission conducted for transcutaneous
energy transmission system (TET). First, the study of active implantable medical devices
(AIMDs) that currently use TET technology with lower power and scale is carried out.
Subsequently the system is divided into blocks and then analyzed in detail the contribution of
each subsystem. Finally, a test architecture is proposed to analyze the interference (IEM)
generated in the whole system as one.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the last decade, various works have demonstrated that a class of artificial material called metamaterials (MTM) can synthesize μ-negative (MNG) media capable of evanescent wave focusing which largely enhances the magnetic coupling between coils, which is the basic mechanism of Inductive Power Transmission (IPT) systems. In the present work, MTM-enhanced coupling in IPT systems is examined through analytical and numerical results, which are validated by experimental data. Adopting a transmission line based approach to describe the general MTM-enhanced IPT system, it is evidenced that MNG MTMs can be interpreted as a negative impedance from a circuital point of view.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In the last decade, various works have demonstrated that a class of artificial material called metamaterials (MTM) can synthesize μ-negative (MNG) media capable of evanescent wave focusing which largely enhances the magnetic coupling between coils, which is the basic mechanism of Inductive Power Transmission (IPT) systems. In the present work, MTM-enhanced coupling in IPT systems is examined through analytical and numerical results, which are validated by experimental data. Adopting a transmission line based approach to describe the general MTM-enhanced IPT system, it is evidenced that MNG MTMs can be interpreted as a negative impedance from a circuital point of view.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A metamaterial-based insulator is proposed for highly compact MIMO-systems. In previous work, the proposed insulator has been demonstrated to reduce efficiently the coupling at PEC boundaries between two very close antennas on a common ground plane. The present study concentrates on the effects of this insulator on the antenna radiation pattern. The chosen operating frequency is 2.4 GHz considering that it is a usual frequency for many indoor wireless applications. The theoretical results are supported by numerical simulations.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A metamaterial-based insulator is proposed for highly compact MIMO-systems. In previous work, the proposed insulator has been demonstrated to reduce efficiently the coupling at PEC boundaries between two very close antennas on a common ground plane. The present study concentrates on the effects of this insulator on the antenna radiation pattern. The chosen operating frequency is 2.4 GHz considering that it is a usual frequency for many indoor wireless applications. The theoretical results are supported by numerical simulations.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A predictive EMC method for inductive coupling, using measurements carried out on a sphere encompassing a tested device, is at the moment under development in our laboratory. This method makes it possible to construct an equivalent source in the form of a sum of multipole terms. Once the equivalent sources of two devices have been designed, their inductive coupling can be calculated to prevent future EMC problems. Therefore, we have developed a measurement bench which allows the sensor to describe a spherical surface around the device we want to characterize. In this article, we present two methods for choosing the position of the measurement points (depending on the number of measurements and the chosen sensor) by minimizing the reconstruction error. The first one determines the position of the measurement points in order for them to be equidistant. In the second one, the source is considered to be random, and we maximize the determinant of the covariance matrix as a function of the sensor positions. This method allows us to define the best measurement points for a chosen number of points. This method is iterative and the number of measurements to be carried out is constrained by the maximum degree of spherical harmonics expansion. A comparison of the performances, advantages and disadvantages of these two methods is proposed and illustrated by an example.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A predictive EMC method for inductive coupling, using measurements carried out on a sphere encompassing a tested device, is at the moment under development in our laboratory. This method makes it possible to construct an equivalent source in the form of a sum of multipole terms. Once the equivalent sources of two devices have been designed, their inductive coupling can be calculated to prevent future EMC problems. Therefore, we have developed a measurement bench which allows the sensor to describe a spherical surface around the device we want to characterize. In this article, we present two methods for choosing the position of the measurement points (depending on the number of measurements and the chosen sensor) by minimizing the reconstruction error. The first one determines the position of the measurement points in order for them to be equidistant. This method allows us to define the best measurement points for a chosen number of points. This method is iterative and the number of measurements to be carried out is constrained by the maximum degree of spherical harmonics expansion. A comparison of the performances, advantages and disadvantages of these two methods is proposed and illustrated by an example.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de máquinas, aparelhos e materiais elétricos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Electromagnetic interference between power electronic systems often causes malfunctions. This problem of electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) has become an essential issue for their design. This work focuses on the near-field inductive coupling between two systems. In order to take it into account during the industrial design phase, a predictive method was proposed, based on the multipole expansion in spherical harmonics of the magnetic induction field measured around each system. The accuracy of the characterization depends on several factors such as the number of measurements, the position of the measuring points, the sensitivity of the measuring instruments, and so on. In addition to the measurements, a priori information on the device is often available, allowing us to improve the accuracy of the identification. In this work, the properties of the expansion in spherical harmonics are linked to the a priori information (particularly geometric) and it is shown how this information can be used to improve the identification problem. In practice, the a priori information is often accompanied by some bias, which also needs to be considered. The methods will be illustrated by a few examples, such as a smoothing inductance.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Electromagnetic interference between power electronic systems often causes malfunctions. This problem of electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) has become an essential issue for their design. This work focuses on the near-field inductive coupling between two systems. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Non-treated transient motor terminal overvoltage due high-speed switching sources and long cable length can be twice the original source voltage amplitude. In some cases, this overvoltage can cause premature motor insulation failure. A topology widely applied in industry is subject of this overvoltage: motors driven by voltage source inverter, connected by long feeding cable. There are several passive methods effective in mitigating overvoltage, but most of them are based in lossy and bulky passive component filters. A different approach is proposed by two low loss active methods for overvoltage mitigation with simple topologies. It consists in using voltage source inverters with specific switching strategy in order to attenuate the main cause of overvoltage: the superposition of traveling reflected pulses at the motor terminals. As promising methods for overvoltage mitigation, some specific studies regarding its particularities must be carried on in order to clear understand all its benefits and possible drawbacks. The present paper discusses the vulnerability of these overvoltage mitigation methods to some internal parameter variation. The impact of cables impedance variation due heating ?and impedance mismatch? is highlighted, since it is intrinsic to the system.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Non-treated transient motor terminal overvoltage due high-speed switching sources and long cable length can be twice the original source voltage amplitude. In some cases, this overvoltage can cause premature motor insulation failure. A topology widely applied in industry is subject of this overvoltage: motors driven by voltage source inverter, connected by long feeding cable. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper considers the resonance phenomena observed on cables connected to power converters, evaluating theoretically and experimentally the voltage amplification due to resonance on these cables. The experimental study was effectuated on cables typically used on industrial applications. Factors restricting resonance-due amplifications are considered, as well as the conditions under which resonance issues may rise in such systems.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper considers the resonance phenomena observed on cables connected to power converters, evaluating theoretically and experimentally the voltage amplification due to resonance on these cables. The experimental study was effectuated on cables typically used on industrial applications. Factors restricting resonance-due amplifications are considered, as well as the conditions under which resonance issues may rise in such systems.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2017 IEEE 3rd Global Electromagnetic Compatibility Conference (GEMCCON)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2017 IEEE 3rd Global Electromagnetic Compatibility Conference (GEMCCON)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a methodology for low-voltage AC surge protective device (SPD) coordination. As motivation, the required nuclear plant reliability and safety criteria, in which the surge protection coordination can assume an important role, are emphasized. Due the characteristics of the protection system, and the surge phenomena, an iterative methodology is applied. The SPD selection and specifications are based on the equipment immunity level, insulation and on SPD characteristics, like absorbed energy. Some results are presented and discussed, showing the suitability of the proposed methodology.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a methodology for low-voltage AC surge protective device (SPD) coordination. As motivation, the required nuclear plant reliability and safety criteria, in which the surge protection coordination can assume an important role, are emphasized. Due the characteristics of the protection system, and the surge phenomena, an iterative methodology is applied. The SPD selection and specifications are based on the equipment immunity level, insulation and on SPD characteristics, like absorbed energy. Some results are presented and discussed, showing the suitability of the proposed methodology.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: Sistema transcutâneo de transmissão de energia

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Metamaterials are difficult to deal with in computational electromagnetic modelling, e.g. finite element analysis. The reason is the prohibitive discretization refinement needed to account for their actual electromagnetic field distribution profile, within the frequency range used in contactless energy transfer devices. We propose an approach to simplify the modeling of a metamaterial in finite element simulations and present an analysis of its impact in the evaluation of the magnetic field distribution in the vicinity of the metamaterial.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Metamaterials are difficult to deal with in computational electromagnetic modelling, e.g. finite element analysis. The reason is the prohibitive discretization refinement needed to account for their actual electromagnetic field distribution profile, within the frequency range used in contactless energy transfer devices. We propose an approach to simplify the modeling of a metamaterial in finite element simulations and present an analysis of its impact in the evaluation of the magnetic field distribution in the vicinity of the metamaterial.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresentaum método e resultados correspondentes à avaliação de emissões conduzidas em modos comum e diferencial de sistemas de Transmissão de Energia Transcutâneo. Diversos aspectos são analisados tais como aqueles relacionados ao posicionamento do implante e determinação das distâncias dos condutores, o que pode influenciar em posteriores testes de emissões radiadas.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação de veículos automotores, reboques e carrocerias

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We study the harmonic magnetodynamic behavior (without wave propagation) of a resonant surface metamaterial, made up of many identical and regularly arranged LC cells. The "circuit" model gives the exact solution, but is not numerically efficient for the simulation of very large structures (e.g. 1000x1000 cells). For the first time, we highlight the modal character of the solutions, which makes it possible to explain their frequency and spatial related properties. From these results, we show under what assumptions it is possible to homogenize the metamaterial, which opens the way for using this approach together with efficient numerical methods.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We study the harmonic magnetodynamic behavior (without wave propagation) of a resonant surface metamaterial, made up of many identical and regularly arranged LC cells. The "circuit" model gives the exact solution, but is not numerically efficient for the simulation of very large structures (e.g. 1000x1000 cells). For the first time, we highlight the modal character of the solutions, which makes it possible to explain their frequency and spatial related properties. From these results, we show under what assumptions it is possible to homogenize the metamaterial, which opens the way for using this approach together with efficient numerical methods.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: MOMAG 2020
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: MOMAG 2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper describes a general methodology for
the description of inductive power and data transfer based on
virtual magnetic transmission-lines (VMGTLs). This approach
presents a better physical insight on the channel behavior since
the model correctly preserves the energy flow between the
transmitting and receiving coils. Particularly, the virtual-TL
analogy clarifies the mechanism of transmission gain
improvement between any two coils assisted by MTM lenses.
Based on the results of this work, these lenses do not enhance the
magnetic coupling between the drivers, as usually claimed, but
create conditions to propagating near-field modes to increase
their power transfer. This approach also reveals that MTMs
could be employed not only for the increasing of power transfer
but also for enlarging the inductive channel bandwidth.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Eletrônica Industrial, Sistemas e Controles Eletrônicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Sobretensão em motores elétricos acionados por
conversores estáticos de frequência representam grande risco à
integridade do equipamento e se intensificam à medida que tais
conversores aperfeiçoam sua velocidade de chaveamento. Os
métodos ativos de redução de sobretensão por superposição de
pulsos se utilizam dos próprios conversores de frequência para
suprimir ou minimizar os pulsos refletidos através do cabo de
acionamento do motor, que geram a sobretensão. Esse artigo
explora alguns desses métodos em termos de eficácia, flexibilidade e robustez e faz uma análise comparativa destes. Também são
realizadas comparações entre sistemas de acionamento dotados
de IGBTs de silício e de MOSFETs de carbeto de silício.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Overvoltage in electric motors driven by
static frequency converters pose a great risk to the
integrity of the equipment and intensify as such
converters optimize your scmring speed. The
active methods of reducing overvoltage by over-strain of
pulses use the frequency converters themselves to
suppress or minimize the pulses reflected through the
motor drive, which generate overvoltage. This article
explores some of these methods in terms of effectiveness, flexibility and robustness and makes a comparative analysis of these. They are also
made comparations between drive systems equipped with
silicon IGBTs and silicon carbide MOSFETs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Analysis of the Electrical Characteristics of Biological Materials Exposed to Electromagnetic Fields

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produtos e Processos Biotecnológicos Vinculados À Saúde Humana Ou dos Animais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents the development of a methodology to evaluate the electromagnetic field effects on the electric characteristics of biological materials. The motivation of this work comes from the current necessity to evaluate possible Non-Ionizing Electromagnetic Radiation (NIR) effects in human-beings. A brief description of thermal effects resulting from the exposure of biological materials to radiation, their mechanisms of interaction and dosimetry techniques is carried out. As an application, some results concerning the relative permittivity of a bovine femur, in the frequency range from 50 MHz to 3 GHz, is presented. A good agreement was gotten when the results were compared with those available in the literature.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Telecomunicação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The effects resulting from direct lightning strikes to buildings may affect the reliable operation of electric and electronic systems installed inside. The influence of such phenomena on equipment and systems depends on the immunity levels, and on the magnetic field intensity due to the lightning current. In this paper, a time-domain simulation of the lightning induced voltage on electric circuits (open metal loops) located inside a high building, a steel structure, is presented. In order to make an extensive analysis, the simulation is carried out considering different regions within the building. The results related to magnetic flux density and induced effects, helpful in determining the critical positions of equipment, are presented, and some of them are compared with those obtained from other methodologies proposed in the literature.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The effects resulting from direct lightning strikes to buildings may affect the reliable operation of electric and electronic systems installed inside. The influence of such phenomena on equipment and systems depends on the immunity levels, and on the magnetic field intensity due to the lightning current. In this paper, a time-domain simulation of the lightning induced voltage on electric circuits (open metal loops) located inside a high building, a steel structure, is presented. In order to make an extensive analysis, the simulation is carried out considering different regions within the building. The results related to magnetic flux density and induced effects, helpful in determining the critical positions of equipment, are presented, and some of them are compared with those obtained from other methodologies proposed in the literature.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Telecomunicação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The prediction of electromagnetic environment have become a mandatory requirement in the design phase of lightning protection systems (L.P.S) of buildings. 
As regards the electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) aspects, the electromagnetic fields and their induced effects due to direct lightning to buildings is one of the most severe causes of malfunction or damage to the electric and electronic equipment installed inside. The influence of such phenomena on equipment and systems depends on the immunity levels, and on the magnetic field intensity due to the lightning current distribution on the L.P.S.
In this paper, the authors present a time-domain simulation concerning the influence of the height of buildings on the L.P.S performance when directly struck by lightning. 
For this purpose two configurations are considered: a high one, and a low one very similar to the last floor of the high building regarding the geometrical and electrical characteristics. The results related to magnetic density flux and induced effects are compared considering different regions within the buildings.
A hybrid method is used, based particularly on the transmission line theory, on the dipole model, and on the finite difference method.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Telecomunicação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The search for the best configuration of the Lightning Protection System (LPS) that maximizes the regions inside the building, in which the values of the field are less than the specified threshold levels is an important topic of the LPS design. In this paper, the authors propose the use of a Constrained Decision Planning tool to optimize the field profile in the regions where the high susceptible equipment will be placed. The induced magnetic flux is evaluated by time-domain simulation. The concepts of "safe area" and "connectivity index" are presented and used as measures of this procedure
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The search for the best configuration of the Lightning Protection System (LPS) that maximizes the regions inside the building, in which the values of the field are less than the specified threshold levels is an important topic of the LPS design. In this paper, the authors propose the use of a Constrained Decision Planning tool to optimize the field profile in the regions where the high susceptible equipment will be placed. The induced magnetic flux is evaluated by time-domain simulation. The concepts of "safe area" and "connectivity index" are presented and used as measures of this procedure

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Limites para exposição humana a campos eletromagnéticos provenientes de estações rádio-base de telefonia celular - Uma comparação com valores medidos

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Telecomunicação
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Políticas, Planejamento e Gestão em Saúde
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Industria Eletro-Eletrônica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
As estações rádio base - ERB´s do Serviço Móvel Celular no Brasil emitem campos eletromagnéticos (CEM) na faixa de freqüências entre 869 MHz e 1990 MHz, conforme designado pela ANATEL em sua Resolução 235. Como as ERB´s operam continuamente, há uma preocupação natural com possíveis efeitos à saúde provocados pelos CEM, associados mais recentemente a Poluição Eletromagnética.
Os valores limites para exposição humana a CEM variam bastante de país para país. Não pretendemos discutir aqui detalhes dos motivos desta variação. É importante, entretanto, destacar dois aspectos básicos sobre estes limites, um deles diz respeito à nossa capacidade de diferenciar entre um efeito biológico dos CEM que não causa mal à saúde e um outro efeito que possa causar mal à saúde, enquanto que o outro aspecto diz respeito a que valores de CEM estamos sujeitos de fato em nosso dia a dia. Se perguntarmos a qualquer pessoa que esteja pesquisando este tema hoje onde há polêmica, uma resposta típica é que se é evidente que o primeiro aspecto é polêmico, com certeza o segundo não o é, e nossa proposta neste artigo é de examinar os extremos das faixas dos limites existentes e comparar o extremo inferior com os valores medidos em campo, verificando se estamos de fato em risco ou não. Os autores têm formação em Engenharia Elétrica e não pretendem discorrer sobre os métodos que os profissionais da área de saúde usam para decidir o que faz ou não mal à saúde, mas, afinal, os limites de exposição são publicados em valores de densidade de potência ( mW/cm2) ou campo elétrico (V/m), números objetivos que podemos verificar nas normas e regulamentos e, quando citado, verificar também quais as razões que levaram os redatores do documento a adotar aqueles números específicos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Avaliação de ambiente eletromagnético em área próxima a uma linha de 345 kV

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-4: Simulação de Campos elétricos e magnéticos

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
RESUMO

Este trabalho apresenta resultados e métodos de medição de campos elétricos e magnéticos próximos a subestações classe 88 kV. Os riscos à saúde associados à exposição humana a estes campos são avaliados mediante a comparação dos valores medidos com os limites estabelecidos em documentos normativos

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Uma Solução Alternativa para as Câmaras Reverberantes de Modos Misturados Atuais

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de Máquinas, Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Sistemas Eletrônicos Dedicados À Automação Industrial e Controle do Processo Produtivo
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação de Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Telecomunicação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta uma alternativa para as configurações de câmaras reverberantes de modos misturados, atualmente propostas pelas normas internacionais, na qual substituem-se as pás mecânicas por arranjos de linhas de transmissão. Uma breve discrição desta configuração e alguns resultados são apresentados, mostrando a viabilidade da adoção deste novo conceito de câmara na avaliação da compatibilidade eletromagnética de sistemas e equipamentos elétricos e eletrônicos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Interferências Eletromagnéticas Resultantes dos Componentes Harmônicos do Sistema de Alimentação de Energia Elétrica de Trens

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Conversão e Retificação da Energia Elétrica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação e Montagem de Embarcações, Veículos Ferroviários e Aeronaves

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta uma metodologia de avaliação da ocorrência de interferência eletromagnética nos equipamentos de sinalização e controle de uma ferrovia eletrificada, sob condição de contingência, na qual a unidade retificadora de tração opera com 6 pulsos e não com os 12 pulsos característicos da sua operação normal. Assim, interferências eletromagnéticas poderão resultar da interação direta do campo magnético com os equipamentos próximos às vias, bem como da indução resultante nos cabos que interligam os equipamentos de sinalização e controle.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Avaliação do Campo Magnético Gerado por Barramentos de Baixa Tensão

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Transmissão da Energia Elétrica, Distribuição da Energia Elétrica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Cuidado À Saúde das Populações Humanas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta uma metodologia de avaliação da interferência eletromagnética em equipamentos de tecnologia de informação (ETI´s) devido a campos magnéticos gerados por cabos e barramentos de baixa tensão, em frequência industrial, situados nas proximidades. A avaliação do campo gerado pelos condutores é feita a partir da lei de Biot-Savart, sendo considerado para os barramentos um coeficiente de blindagem, estimado através de simulações pelo método dos elementos finitos (MEF). Também é feito um estudo da influência de harmônicos de 3.a ordem, presentes em cargas de ETI's, no campo total gerado pelos condutores.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Wavelets application in electrostatic and their computing aspects

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the mathematical basis, and some results, concerning the application of the Haar's wavelets as the expansion function in the Method of Moments. Some computational optimization techniques are used, and their main aspects are emphasized in the paper. As an example, the surface charge density on a finite and thin plane plate calculation is presented, in which the main computational performance aspects are evaluated.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Application of Haar's Wavelets in the Method of Moment to solve Electrostatic Problems

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents the mathematics basis, and some results, concerning the application of Haar's wavelets, as an expansion function, in the Method of Moment to solve Electrostatic Problems. 
As an example, the superface charge densities on a finite straight wire and on a thin square plate are evaluated. The comparative results related to the Haar's wavelets and the conventional expansion functions are presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Contribuição a Aplicação das Wavelets na Eletrostática

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta uma metodologia para a determinação da densidade superficial de carga em duas estruturas simples, um fio reto finito e uma chapa plana quadrada ambas submetidas a um potencial constante. A metodologia envolve o método dos momentos, utilizando como função de expansão as wavelets de Haar ao invés da função pulso, visando a obtenção de uma boa precisão e de uma redução no esforço computacional. Através de um artifício matemático, podemos selecionar um limiar em porcentagem que permite descartar valores próximos de zero, sem grandes variações no resultado final. Apresentamos também as vantagens computacionais, que podemos obter através da decomposição de Cholesky.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Application of Spice simulator in the evaluation of crosstlak computation models

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação e Montagem de Embarcações, Veículos Ferroviários e Aeronaves
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação e Montagem de Automóveis, Caminhões, Ônibus e Tratores e Demais Máquinas e Implementos Agrícolas, Reboques e Carrocerias

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents an evaluation of the crosstalk models developed for a shareware version of SPICE. The transmission line model is compared with lumped circuit models by varying the number of cells. The influence of losses is also introduced, and some constraints regarding the models are examined, showing the suitability of the new Spice libraries developed by the authors. In order to validate the theoretical results some experiments were carried out. Moreover, the main aspects concerning the accuracy and integrity of the experimental data are emphasized and discussed in this paper.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Adaptative Object Models Architecture for Simulation Software Design

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Software - Interfaces Gráficas de Entrada e Saída

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta uma metodologia inovadora relacionada à engenharia de software que visa, por um lado, minimizar o tempo e o custo de desenvolvimento destes e, por outro lado, auxiliar o projetista a trabalhar com o crescente grau de complexidade relacionados aos processos de simulação. Baseia-se, principalmente, na aplicação de "modelos de objetos adaptativos", na qual destaca-se à técnica conhecida como "meta modelo". Assim, a ferramenta proposta é apresentada, enfatizando-se sua aplicação na modelagem e no desenvolvimento de uma nova geração de softwares de simulação.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Evaluation of the Grounding System Influence on Field Coordination Studies Applied to LPS Optimization

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Studies in Applied Electromagnetics and Mechanics

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SARTORI, Carlos Antonio França;Sartori, Carlos A. F.;SARTORI, C. A. F.;SARTORI, CARLOS;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO FRANCA;SARTORI, CARLOS ANTONIO F.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents an evaluation of the grounding system influence on a Lightning Protection System (LPS) optimization process, in which the Constrained Decision Planning method is applied. The evaluation approach is based on the Field Coordination studies that take into account the resulting magnetic field effects in the regions where the equipment will be placed and the relating threshold levels. The induced magnetic flux is evaluated by time-domain simulations, and the concepts of "safe area" and "connectivity index" are used as measures of this procedure.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a methodology concerning Surge Protective Device (SPD) Coordination Studies; taking into account the available tools of the student version of the ?Spice?. As an approach to satisfy the related limitations of this version, preliminary analytical studies are carried out; allowing us to selected a list of the available Spice SPD models to be applied in the simulations. Some applications regarding residential installations were chosen, and their results are presented and compared with the ones presented in literature.

Some applications regarding residential installations were chosen, and their results are presented and compared with the ones presented in literature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Numerical Evaluation of Noncanonical Reverberation Chamber Configurations
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Numerical Evaluation of Noncanonical Reverberation Chamber Configurations

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper aims to present an evaluation of noncanonical mode stirred chambers, whose excitation is carried out by transmission lines. Many configurations are taken into account regarding the influence of the wire arrangement and their phase shift excitation on the field homogeneity. The simulations were carried out within the framework of finite integration technique (FIT) and transmissionline modeling (TLM) methods. Experimental and theoretical results are presented regarding the chamber suitability to electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) tests. It is emphasized the viability of extending the present standard frequency range recommendation to lower frequency values.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper aims to present an evaluation of noncanonical mode stirred chambers, whose excitation is carried out by transmission lines. Many configurations are taken into account regarding the influence of the wire arrangement and their phase shift excitation on the field homogeneity. The simulations were carried out within the framework of finite integration technique (FIT) and transmissionline modeling (TLM) methods. Experimental and theoretical results are presented regarding the chamber suitability to electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) tests. It is emphasized the viability of extending the present standard frequency range recommendation to lower frequency values.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Maximum Working Volume Evaluation in a Non-Canonical Reverberation Chamber
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Maximum Working Volume Evaluation in a Non-Canonical Reverberation Chamber

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a procedure for evaluating the performance of reverberation chambers, by approximating the maximum working volume in a given configuration. The evaluation of this volume is based on the geometrical and physical constraints, e.g. the ones related to the internal E-field distribution recommended by standards. The importance of the present work is related to the development of a non-canonical reverberation chamber configuration, whose excitation is carried out by transmission lines, instead of antennas plus paddles.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a procedure for evaluating the performance of reverberation chambers, by approximating the maximum working volume in a given configuration. The evaluation of this volume is based on the geometrical and physical constraints, e.g. the ones related to the internal E-field distribution recommended by standards. The importance of the present work is related to the development of a non-canonical reverberation chamber configuration, whose excitation is carried out by transmission lines, instead of antennas plus paddles.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work introduces a new generation of magnetic field sensors, based on the spherical harmonic decomposition concept. The measurement principle is similar to a spatial filtering: according to the coil shape, the sensors are just sensitive to a specific component of the multipolar expansion. Five coil shapes are determined, in order to account for the first two orders of the multipolar expansion. The way of determining the coil shape is first explained, and a validation is proposed using a finite element software.

The measurement principle is similar to a spatial filtering: according to the coil shape, the sensors are just sensitive to a specific component of the multipolar expansion. Five coil shapes are determined, in order to account for the first two orders of the multipolar expansion. The way of determining the coil shape is first explained, and a validation is proposed using a finite element software.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fault Classification and Detection by Wavelet Based Magnetic Signature Recognition.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Fault Classification and Detection by Wavelet Based Magnetic Signature Recognition

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A non-invasive methodology to evaluate and classify electrical system failures is presented in this work. It is based on the electrical system magnetic signature recognition by using the wavelet signal decomposition and the resulting variance spectrum evaluation, respectively. The proposed methodology was validated by comparing theoretical and experimental results. The Finite Element Method was used in the numerical simulations of the magnetic flux density, and a post-processing approach was adopted in the signal decomposition and analyses. An experimental setup was built to obtain the magnetic signature regarding some pre-selected fault configurations.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A non-invasive methodology to evaluate and classify electrical system failures is presented in this work. It is based on the electrical system magnetic signature recognition by using the wavelet signal decomposition and the resulting variance spectrum evaluation, respectively. The proposed methodology was validated by comparing theoretical and experimental results. The Finite Element Method was used in the numerical simulations of the magnetic flux density, and a post-processing approach was adopted in the signal decomposition and analyses. An experimental setup was built to obtain the magnetic signature regarding some pre-selected fault configurations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Conductor Position Optimization of a Transmission Line Excitation Chamber
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Conductor Position Optimization of a Transmission Line Excitation Chamber

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: camaras excitadas por linhas de transmissão

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a hybrid mono/multi-objective optimization approach based on numerical, statistical and fitness evaluation concerning the conductor positions in a Transmission Line Excitation Chamber. The field profile and the related indexes of merit, like statistical ones, regarding the working volumes are used to evaluate the chamber configuration performance. The compromise between working volume and E-field standard deviation are shown through the Pareto?s Front. An index of merit based on area calculation under the Pareto?s Front is defined and used for transmission line set comparison.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a hybrid mono/multi-objective optimization approach based on numerical, statistical and fitness evaluation concerning the conductor positions in a Transmission Line Excitation Chamber. The field profile and the related indexes of merit, like statistical ones, regarding the working volumes are used to evaluate the chamber configuration performance. The compromise between working volume and E-field standard deviation are shown through the Pareto?s Front. An index of merit based on area calculation under the Pareto?s Front is defined and used for transmission line set comparison.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents an evaluation of the phase shifting excitation and load effects in a Transmission Line Exciting Chamber. This chamber is suggested as an alternative for immunity tests because of the restrictions related to canonical chambers. Here, two methods are used to calculate the E-field: a semi-analytic approach and a numerical one. The semi-analytic method is based on the modal expansion while a software is used for numerical simulations. The results regarding the E-field profile and the related statistical indexes of merit are presented and used to evaluate the chamber performances. Experiments were also conducted in order to evaluate the chamber.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electromagnetic interference between electronic systems or between their components influences the overall performance. It is important thus to model these interferences in order to optimize the position of the components of an electronic system. In this paper, a methodology to construct the equivalent model of magnetic field sources is proposed. It is based on the multipole expansion and it represents the radiated emission of generic structures in a spherical reference frame. Experimental results for different kinds of sources are presented illustrating our method.

Experimental results for different kinds of sources are presented illustrating our method.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electromagnetic interference between the electronic systems or their components influences the performance of the systems. For that reason, it is important to model these interferences in order to optimize the position of the systems or their components. In this paper, a method is proposed to construct the equivalent emission source models of systems. The proposed method is based on the multipolar expansion by representing the radiated emission of generic structures in a spherical reference. Some results are presented illustrating our method.

In this paper, a method is proposed to construct the equivalent emission source models of systems. The proposed method is based on the multipolar expansion by representing the radiated emission of generic structures in a spherical reference. Some results are presented illustrating our method.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Polyphase Drive Systems Configuration aiming EMI Mitigation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Polyphase Drive Systems Configuration aiming EMI Mitigation

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Eletrônica Industrial, Sistemas e Controles Eletrônicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Topologies of motor drive systems are studied,
aiming the reduction of common-mode (CM) currents. Initially,
the aspects concerning the CM currents circulation are analysed.
The reason of common-mode voltages generation, the circulating
paths for the resulting CM currents and their effects are
discussed. Then, a non-conventional drive system configuration
is proposed in order to reduce the CM currents and their effects.
This configuration comprehends a non-conventional inverter
module wired to a motor with an unusual connection. The cables
arrangement differs from the standard solution, too. The
proposed topology is compared with other ones, like the active
circuit for common-mode voltages compensation. The
contribution of the configuration to the reduction of CM voltages
and currents and their related interferences are evaluated, based
on numerical simulations. Some results are presented and
discussed regarding the suitability of the proposed configuration
as a potential solution to reduce the CM currents effects, when
the state of art and implementation cost of drives are taken into
account.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

the state of art and implementation cost of drives are taken into
account.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Overview on the Evolution of Near Magnetic Field Coupling Prediction Using Equivalent Multipole Spherical Harmonic Sources
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Overview on the Evolution of Near Magnetic Field Coupling Prediction Using Equivalent Multipole Spherical Harmonic Sources

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Eletrônica Industrial, Sistemas e Controles Eletrônicos

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the ElectroMagnetic Compatibility (EMC) behaviour of power electronic converters, parasitic magnetic couplings between components are one of the main causes of dysfunctions or poor filtering. These couplings may be either conducted or near-field interferences. To handle interaction problems, full knowledge of these magnetic couplings is essential. This article is an overview of the work on near magnetic field interference undertaken in the last 15 years by the International Maxwell Laboratory. This paper details a predictive method that accurately and efficiently calculates near magnetic field coupling between two sources. The method uses near-field multipolar expansion in spherical harmonics of electromagnetic sources to determine close magnetic coupling between two sources from their equivalent models. This paper also shows how theoretical developments of large loop antennas have evolved from the van Veen antenna, a model with only two degrees of freedom, to a more complex model in terms of degrees, order and types of harmonics. In parallel, it describes developments in the measurement method that provides input to the theoretical model. To illustrate how the research has evolved, we discuss coupling between two complex sources to assess the accuracy of this predictive method
